intro: Jacksonia trifoliata, commonly known as the New Zealand daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with trifoliate leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped. Jacksonia trifoliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
